RecitationInstruction.ab: III gwptn'] 5, 15, 40; III bʾl gwptn' 400; III bʾl 410.

Quotations.ab: u-š aṣ̌əm vohū ī dudīgar ī barsom gōwišn ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay hād staōmi aṣ̌əm ka nē pad barsom gōwēd ā nē šāyēd
"He has to say the second aṣ̌əm vohū of the barsom. There is one commentator who says that, if he does not recite staōmi aṣ̌əm, then it is not allowed."

ModernPractice.ab: "While reciting a. v. 3, the zot cups his right hand, bends over, scoops some water from the large metal basin and sprinkles it on the date-palm cord ( aiwyāhan) tied around the metal wires ( barsom) placed across the crescent shaped stands (māh-rūy). He picks up the barsom with his left hand, grasps that hand with his right, and touches the tip of the barsom wires to the tops of the crescent-shaped stands, touching the stand furthest away first, then the closest one."

Commentary.ab: On the number of Aṣ̌əm Vohū in the Frastuiiē section, vid. Y12.5.
